summary: Nr. 32 Solo: A Star Wars Story
title: Nr. 32 Solo: A Star Wars Story
body:
**Info am Rande: Da ich immer noch erheblich hinterher hinke, folgen die nächsten Bewertungen im Schnellformat:

In der Vorgeschichte zum jungen Han Solo (Alden Ehrenreich) versucht dieser seine große Liebe Kira (Emilia Clarke) aus den Fängen des Bösewichts Dryden Vos (Paul Bettany) zu befreien. Begleitet wird er von Mentor Beckett (Woody Harrelson), Lando Calrissian (Donald Glover) und natürlich Chewbacca…

Natürlich, die Besetzung ist ausgesprochen sehenswert, doch von einem Star Wars Ableger erwartet man einfach mehr. Die Story ist plump, wenig ausgefeilt und stellenweise sogar langweilig. Regisseur Ron Howard (Illuminati, Apollo 13) enttäuscht mit diesem Film, denn einen Helden wie Han Solo hätte man deutlich origineller darstellen können.

Daher bekommt „Solo: A Star Wars Story“: 5 von 10 Sternen

blog.name: pinfildiarts
blog.title: Pinfildi Roberto's Artblog - Charuzu was here ....
blog.description:
Scuola Italiana di Comix Artist / Male / 24 / Taken / Italy

Welcome, I'am a Cartoonist from Naples, Italy. I attend in 2013 the "Scuola Italiana di Comix" the Italian School of Comix". I Study Comics, Digital Coloring and Drawing.I have this passion for comics, illustration, animation and concept arts  and especially Graffiti.

I also participated in  "Napoli Comicon" at the stand of my school of comics "Scuola Italiana di Comix"  from 2015, where I greeted the audience.

A Cartoonist who love draws OC's,  Fanarts and tributes, in particular drawings inspiring the great cartoonists, Artists and Illustrators.

My Bio
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/post/160865299019/short-biography-note-for-updates-the-post-will

My Art Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/myart

Original Art Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/originalart

Fanart Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/fanart

Graffiti Doodles Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/graffitidoodles

Japan Stuff Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/japan

My life Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/mylife

Inspiration Tag
http://pinfildiarts.tumblr.com/tagged/inspiration

My Behance
www.behance.net/robertopin6825

My Flickr for graffiti photography https://www.flickr.com/photos/137854550@N04/


DON'T STEAL, TRACING, COPYING MY ART! BAN & REPORT NOW! 

I DON'T TAKE REQUEST! I'am very busy at school of comics 

Anyway, i post also my stuff and many more! Stay Tune! Follow me if you like my stuff =)

*** Pinfildiarts x freelyfurryartisan (aka Valentinatuosto1992) ***

blog.title: Making the Best of Law School
blog.description: Hey, people! So, this blog is for anything and everything law school related, plus anything that just makes me happy. :-)

title: Star Wars Cookies
body: Random thought of the day: Someone in the Star Wars franchise needs to make a cookie joke sometime during one of the movies. Like, one of the super grim First Order officials needs to just snap after they suffer another loss. Like they suddenly take off their insignia pin or helmet and throw it down and shout, “That’s it! I quit! I was promised cookies and you know what?! I never got any cookies!” Then they just storm out while everyone else just stares in shock. Bonus points if Kylo Ren is standing there just watching them go, too stunned to even try to strangle them with the Force.

summary: For anono...enjoy! He couldn’t stand it. It had been years since his heart had made the wretched decision. It had to be her too....
caption:
For anono…enjoy!

He couldn’t stand it. It had been years since his heart had made the wretched decision. It had to be her too. Y/N, the daughter of the highest of commanding officers. She was beautiful in her strength and will. Impressive in her ability to command a room. Half of her father’s men were just as scared of her as they were of her father.

It had to be her. His rebellious heart had decided to latch onto her. His mind knew she was promised, betrothed, to someone else. He also knew it was a political tactic set in place by her father and the Supreme Leader. Why couldn’t his heart understand what his mind was so desperately trying to tell it. She could never be his, not fully.

Even if the pair had been foolish enough to start a series of trysts, neither would be happy. Not truly. The atmosphere would break and both would realize their positions. Y/N had stated she didn’t care, she just wanted to be with him. He knew better. Neither would be truly happy. 

He wished it was like way back in his history where the revered married for politics but fraternized for love. At least they had an understanding in their marriage. But no, that’s not how things worked. He was sure whoever were to marry her would be as possessive as he knew he would be. 

He couldn’t stand it.

His feet were in motion before he could stop himself. His expression remained light with practiced ease. She went with him, more than eager to escape the gala climate for awhile. His mind didn’t listen to the destination his heart was driving toward.

Deep in the garden, the pair stopped. Y/N looked at him with those fierce hopeful eyes. All at once, the two lunged at each other, their lips connecting like a storm. Desperation led their actions. It allowed pause, but their foreheads remained connected. 

“I love you, Y/N,” he dared to utter, “More than I’ve ever loved anything. I can’t bear the thought of you being with someone else.”
“Neither can I,” she admitted, “My heart will always be yours, regardless of who I must call my husband.”
He closed his eyes. “Should…Are we going to do this?”
She smiled broadly. “I’d rather not be kept waiting any longer.”

He chuckled. Maybe…Maybe it was worth breaking an atmosphere. He could be with her, even for a moment.

Perma-tags: @beeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep @ttelesilla @jumperswellies @caitsymichelle13 @frostbyte-horan @bestillmystuckyheart @littlestfangirl @anali-022506 @krylo-rxn @ilovetvshowsblog @yllwtaxi @mimikyu-of-death
Semi-tags: @bi-shy-and-ready-to-die @michaelathewordsmith

summary:
Or a headcanon/Ep IX treatment I have right now that I would like you to consider.
Been noodling this around in my head for a...
body:
The symbolism of forgiveness

Or a headcanon/Ep IX treatment I have right now that I would like you to consider.

Been noodling this around in my head for a while. What if Kylo Ren’s has been looking for the wrong legacy lightsaber the whole time? After all, he feels Anakin’s blue one is his birthright. But what if there is another one that is the one that that lights the path for a journey of forgiveness?

So consider this current headcanon…

Somewhere in near the end of Act I Of Ep IX, Hux has staged a coup and Rey—who has learned to keep her end of the Force one closed—senses it and cannot ignore it, because Kylo’s life is in danger. The remaining Knights of Ren led by their new master played by Keri Russell are loyal to Hux.

Like ANH and ROTJ, we get an epic jail break, and an injured Kylo Ren before his very public execution. Rey and Chewie are successful this time. Kylo is in no condition to fight them (or anyone for that matter) and they can’t bring him to the resistance because he’s the enemy. This makes them fugitives with both sides.

With nowhere to go, Rey and Chewie spirit Kylo away to the one safe place she knows he can recover—Ahch-To. The Caretakers take them in and tend to Kylo’s injuries.

One night, Rey checks on him in the hut where he is sleeping, mirroring the night Luke crept into his Padawan hut and nearly killed him. He restlessly sleeps, and Rey gently proves his memories and sees Snoke (see, he makes an appearance) preying on the child Kylo once was, twisting words and poisoning the child against those who love him. We see the crying young child, confirming some of the casting rumors.

Kylo wakes and grabs her wrist. His thoughts immediately go to the night he woke to Luke standing over him. He’s fight or flight, but before he can fight back, she frantically tries to reassure him she’s not there to harm him.

He knows she’s been in his mind and asks, “What did you see?”

She quietly answers something like, “You were just a child.” She understands the long game Snoke played to lure a young Ben Solo toward the darkness.

Shame, anger, fear—it doesn’t matter—Kylo hisses, “Get out!” And the scene ends with her bolting out of his hut.

As he recovers and able to move about, he is now dressed in earthen tones, in clothing from previous visitors to the island have left behind. (There’s a passage in Fry’s TLJ of the Caretskers carefully packing away Luke’s belongings and lightsaber, storing them with other items previous visitor left behind. A very interesting point if you ask me.)

He is quiet, sullen and dispondant. He avoids Rey much like Luke initially did in TLJ as she feels him even pull away and lessen his Force presence. It’s easy to see Kylo—if left to his own devices becoming the broken man much like is uncle who cuts himself from others and the Force in this primitive island.

But Rey is best at one thing, as Fry points out—she is good at waiting.

Then things change one night.

He wakes in the middle of the night and is drawn to the trunk in a nearby hut where the caretakers have stored Luke’s belongings. He opens it and takes out Luke’s green saber. We get a Forceback of his childhood revealing some tragic event that set things in motion where Leia sends him to Luke, a conversation he had never heard where his mother and uncle talk about sending him to Luke not to abandon him but rather as a desperate act of love to save his very soul and ends with him waking to Luke standing over him with saber drawn. His backstory is now complete.

End Forceback and ghost Luke is now standing in the room behind him. He points out that he’d always meant to one day give Ben his lightsaber when he completed his training as he was the last Skywalker, but Luke points out in a moment of weakness, he instead nearly took Ben’s life with it.

Luke apologizes a second time (the first on Crait) emphasis given this time that Ben wasn’t just a frighten Med boy whose master had failed him. This time it is more heartfelt, pointing out the familial ties and how as his nephew, he was the closest thing Luke had to a son.

Silent tears roll down Ben’s face, now understanding that Snoke was a liar and a thief. His family hadn’t abandoned him and never stopped loving him.

Luke encourages him to keep the lightsaber. All Ben can do is nod as he finally accepts it and the apology, and the darkness lifts a bit, and Kylo Ren becomes just a name, no longer an identity.

As Luke vanishes, Rey is standing at the open doorway. She has seen what has happened and echoes what he said in TLJ, “You’re not alone.”

They embrace, and this time Luke doesn’t appear and blow the hut up.

Peace is short lived as ships pop out of hyperspace above the islands. The Knights of Ren figured out the partial “map to Skywalker” and are itching for a fight. Just like PG fight, it’s many vs two. In the darkness (oh hell, let’s Make it raining for badassery sake) Rey takes her staff and reveals that the blue saber’s halved crystal now fuels both ends of a saber staff.

A few seconds later Ben ignites the green one. The instrument that nearly killed him will now save his life. We get an eight way lightsaber battle. Ben and Rey win. Rey uses both sides of the Force, maybe lighting too. She is a center point for balance. Ben realizes that one can live with the duality of light and dark.

And in this sequence, the very lightsaber that nearly took his life years ago becomes a symbol of forgiveness an a light to illuminate his path home.

In the darkness (oh hell, let’s Make it raining for badassery sake) Rey takes her staff and reveals that the blue saber’s halved crystal now fuels both ends of a saber staff.

A few seconds later Ben ignites the green one. The instrument that nearly killed him will now save his life. We get an eight way lightsaber battle. Ben and Rey win. Rey uses both sides of the Force, maybe lighting too. She is a center point for balance. Ben realizes that one can live with the duality of light and dark.

And in this sequence, the very lightsaber that nearly took his life years ago becomes a symbol of forgiveness an a light to illuminate his path home.

trail.content_raw:
The symbolism of forgiveness

Or a headcanon/Ep IX treatment I have right now that I would like you to consider.

Been noodling this around in my head for a while. What if Kylo Ren’s has been looking for the wrong legacy lightsaber the whole time? After all, he feels Anakin’s blue one is his birthright. But what if there is another one that is the one that that lights the path for a journey of forgiveness?

So consider this current headcanon…

Somewhere in near the end of Act I Of Ep IX, Hux has staged a coup and Rey—who has learned to keep her end of the Force one closed—senses it and cannot ignore it, because Kylo’s life is in danger. The remaining Knights of Ren led by their new master played by Keri Russell are loyal to Hux.

Like ANH and ROTJ, we get an epic jail break, and an injured Kylo Ren before his very public execution. Rey and Chewie are successful this time. Kylo is in no condition to fight them (or anyone for that matter) and they can’t bring him to the resistance because he’s the enemy. This makes them fugitives with both sides.

With nowhere to go, Rey and Chewie spirit Kylo away to the one safe place she knows he can recover—Ahch-To. The Caretakers take them in and tend to Kylo’s injuries.

One night, Rey checks on him in the hut where he is sleeping, mirroring the night Luke crept into his Padawan hut and nearly killed him. He restlessly sleeps, and Rey gently proves his memories and sees Snoke (see, he makes an appearance) preying on the child Kylo once was, twisting words and poisoning the child against those who love him. We see the crying young child, confirming some of the casting rumors.

Kylo wakes and grabs her wrist. His thoughts immediately go to the night he woke to Luke standing over him. He’s fight or flight, but before he can fight back, she frantically tries to reassure him she’s not there to harm him.

He knows she’s been in his mind and asks, “What did you see?”

She quietly answers something like, “You were just a child.” She understands the long game Snoke played to lure a young Ben Solo toward the darkness.

Shame, anger, fear—it doesn’t matter—Kylo hisses, “Get out!” And the scene ends with her bolting out of his hut.

As he recovers and able to move about, he is now dressed in earthen tones, in clothing from previous visitors to the island have left behind. (There’s a passage in Fry’s TLJ of the Caretskers carefully packing away Luke’s belongings and lightsaber, storing them with other items previous visitor left behind. A very interesting point if you ask me.)

He is quiet, sullen and dispondant. He avoids Rey much like Luke initially did in TLJ as she feels him even pull away and lessen his Force presence. It’s easy to see Kylo—if left to his own devices becoming the broken man much like is uncle who cuts himself from others and the Force in this primitive island.

But Rey is best at one thing, as Fry points out—she is good at waiting.

Then things change one night.

He wakes in the middle of the night and is drawn to the trunk in a nearby hut where the caretakers have stored Luke’s belongings. He opens it and takes out Luke’s green saber. We get a Forceback of his childhood revealing some tragic event that set things in motion where Leia sends him to Luke, a conversation he had never heard where his mother and uncle talk about sending him to Luke not to abandon him but rather as a desperate act of love to save his very soul and ends with him waking to Luke standing over him with saber drawn. His backstory is now complete.

End Forceback and ghost Luke is now standing in the room behind him. He points out that he’d always meant to one day give Ben his lightsaber when he completed his training as he was the last Skywalker, but Luke points out in a moment of weakness, he instead nearly took Ben’s life with it.

Luke apologizes a second time (the first on Crait) emphasis given this time that Ben wasn’t just a frighten Med boy whose master had failed him. This time it is more heartfelt, pointing out the familial ties and how as his nephew, he was the closest thing Luke had to a son.

Silent tears roll down Ben’s face, now understanding that Snoke was a liar and a thief. His family hadn’t abandoned him and never stopped loving him.

Luke encourages him to keep the lightsaber. All Ben can do is nod as he finally accepts it and the apology, and the darkness lifts a bit, and Kylo Ren becomes just a name, no longer an identity.

As Luke vanishes, Rey is standing at the open doorway. She has seen what has happened and echoes what he said in TLJ, “You’re not alone.”

They embrace, and this time Luke doesn’t appear and blow the hut up.

Peace is short lived as ships pop out of hyperspace above the islands. The Knights of Ren figured out the partial “map to Skywalker” and are itching for a fight. Just like PG fight, it’s many vs two. In the darkness (oh hell, let’s Make it raining for badassery sake) Rey takes her staff and reveals that the blue saber’s halved crystal now fuels both ends of a saber staff.

A few seconds later Ben ignites the green one. The instrument that nearly killed him will now save his life. We get an eight way lightsaber battle. Ben and Rey win. Rey uses both sides of the Force, maybe lighting too. She is a center point for balance. Ben realizes that one can live with the duality of light and dark.

And in this sequence, the very lightsaber that nearly took his life years ago becomes a symbol of forgiveness an a light to illuminate his path home.
trail.content:
The symbolism of forgiveness

Or a headcanon/Ep IX treatment I have right now that I would like you to consider.

Been noodling this around in my head for a while. What if Kylo Ren’s has been looking for the wrong legacy lightsaber the whole time? After all, he feels Anakin’s blue one is his birthright. But what if there is another one that is the one that that lights the path for a journey of forgiveness?

Kylo is in no condition to fight them (or anyone for that matter) and they can’t bring him to the resistance because he’s the enemy. This makes them fugitives with both sides.

(There’s a passage in Fry’s TLJ of the Caretskers carefully packing away Luke’s belongings and lightsaber, storing them with other items previous visitor left behind. A very interesting point if you ask me.)

He is quiet, sullen and dispondant. He avoids Rey much like Luke initially did in TLJ as she feels him even pull away and lessen his Force presence. It’s easy to see Kylo—if left to his own devices becoming the broken man much like is uncle who cuts himself from others and the Force in this primitive island.

Then things change one night.

He wakes in the middle of the night and is drawn to the trunk in a nearby hut where the caretakers have stored Luke’s belongings. He opens it and takes out Luke’s green saber. As Luke vanishes, Rey is standing at the open doorway. She has seen what has happened and echoes what he said in TLJ, “You’re not alone.”

They embrace, and this time Luke doesn’t appear and blow the hut up.

Peace is short lived as ships pop out of hyperspace above the islands. The Knights of Ren figured out the partial “map to Skywalker” and are itching for a fight. Just like PG fight, it’s many vs two. In the darkness (oh hell, let’s Make it raining for badassery sake) Rey takes her staff and reveals that the blue saber’s halved crystal now fuels both ends of a saber staff.

A few seconds later Ben ignites the green one. The instrument that nearly killed him will now save his life. We get an eight way lightsaber battle. Ben and Rey win. And in this sequence, the very lightsaber that nearly took his life years ago becomes a symbol of forgiveness an a light to illuminate his path home.

summary: Padmé on Batuu poster, with art by Darren Tan, available with the Barnes & Noble exclusive hardcover edition of the 'Thrawn:...
caption:
Padmé on Batuu poster, with art by Darren Tan, available with the Barnes & Noble exclusive hardcover edition of the ‘Thrawn: Alliances’ novel, written by Timothy Zahn.

On sale July 24 2018, and available for pre-order now from the Barnes & Noble website.

summary: This’ll brighten up your day. [points at sun] Gonna explode eventually tho. It all ends in darkness. Anyway kids, I’m your...
text: This’ll brighten up your day. [points at sun] Gonna explode eventually tho. It all ends in darkness. Anyway kids, I’m your substitute today.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

title: Kote lo'shebs'ul narit
body:
[koh-TAY low SHEBS-ool NAH-rit]

You can keep your glory. (Contemptuous and impolite.)
